Quick google: I bought a couple of 120GB SATA drives on Friday, and I thought why not use the nVidia FakeRAID on my mobo. Turns out that only Gentoo and Fedora 5 have support for FakeRAID on the install media itself.

Hence I had to go looking for details on installing Debian/Ubuntu on FakeRAID. Turns out that while dmraid (the software that provides support for FakeRAID has not been integrated with the installer, but is in the repositories, and it is possible to get an installation up and running somehow.
http://people.ubuntu-in.org/~soumyadip/blog/index.php?/archives/25-The-case-for-FakeRAID-support-in-Linux-installers.html (if it helps)
